news.views.home(request)[source]

Home page displaying recent published articles with pagination.

This view displays the main landing page of the news application, showing the most recent published articles with pagination support. The page also includes categories and publishers for navigation.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – HTTP request object containing user session and query parameters

Returns:

Rendered home page template with articles, categories, and publishers context

Return type:

HttpResponse

news.views.register(request)[source]

User registration view with role selection and automatic login.

This view handles user registration with role-based account creation. Users can register as readers, editors, or journalists. Upon successful registration, users are automatically logged in and redirected to home.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – HTTP request object containing POST data for registration or GET for displaying the form

Returns:

Registration form template for GET requests, or redirect to home page after successful registration

Return type:

HttpResponse or HttpResponseRedirect

class news.api_views.ArticleListAPIView(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: ListCreateAPIView

API view for listing and creating articles with role-based filtering.

This view provides REST API endpoints for retrieving and creating articles with role-based access control. The queryset is filtered based on the authenticated user’s role and subscriptions.

GET /api/articles/: List articles based on user role and

subscriptions

POST /api/articles/: Create new article (journalists only)

Parameters:

  • serializer_class (ArticleSerializer) – ArticleSerializer for request/response serialization

  • permission_classes (list) – List of permission classes, requires authentication

get_queryset()[source]

Filter articles based on user role and subscriptions.

This method implements role-based filtering for articles: - Readers: See only published articles from their subscriptions - Journalists: See only their own articles - Editors: See articles from their publishers and pending articles

Returns:

Filtered QuerySet of articles based on user permissions and subscriptions

Return type:

QuerySet
